intro: Paepalanthus dasynema, commonly known as the Chilean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The plant is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
